title: Mission 2031
content:
Mission 2031" refers to several major Indian government initiatives focused on achieving self-reliance (Atmanirbhar) and significant development by the year 2031, primarily the National Pulses Mission for self-sufficiency in pulses and the Uttar Pradesh (UP) Government's rural development plan for infrastructure transformation, alongside efforts in IT and exports. The Pulses Mission aims to boost domestic production through assured procurement and support, while UP's plan invests heavily in rural infrastructure and services, all targeting enhanced farmer income, food security, and balanced growth. 
Key Missions and Initiatives
National Pulses Mission (India):
Goal: Self-reliance in pulses (tur, urad, masoor) by 2030-31, increasing production to 350 lakh tonnes.
Strategy: Cluster-based approach, 100% procurement under PM-AASHA, and establishing processing units.
Uttar Pradesh (UP) Mission 2031 (Rural):
Goal: Transform UP's villages by upgrading infrastructure and essential services.
Strategy: A proposal for over ₹2.15 lakh crore for gram panchayats, block, and district levels for roads, water, sanitation, and connectivity.
Kerala IT Vision 2031:
Goal: Make Kerala a leading IT/innovation hub, targeting $50 billion IT value.
Strategy: Establishing Centres of Excellence, promoting FOSS, training in AI, and boosting AVGC sector.
Export Promotion Mission:
Goal: Incentivize labor-intensive exports like textiles and leather.
Strategy: Likely continuing until 2031 with increased allocations to counter US tariffs. 
In essence, Mission 2031 signifies India's strategic push across agriculture (pulses, oilseeds), rural infrastructure (UP), and technology (Kerala) towards greater self-sufficiency and balanced national development by the end of the decade.
